response:
- In the 1860s, he traveled to London and met Japanese prints. The shimmering water and the light on the water lilies left a deep impression on him. He bought Japanese prints and started to use Japanese techniques and motifs in his paintings. With the help of his friend, Monet was even able to visit Japan. 

- After he was inspired by Japanese art, Claude Monet wanted to take a trip to Japan. In 1876, he was able to realize his dream, and in the fall of that year, he traveled to Japan for the first time. 

- In 1883, Claude Monet was invited to participate in the first Impressionism exhibition. Claude Monet had a very high reputation in the art world at this time, and at this time, many artists also started to follow the Impressionist style.

- Claude Monet’s famous painting “The Water Lilies” series is one of the best examples of his Impressionism style.

- The painting “The Water Lilies” series has “The Water Lily Pond” and “The Water Lilies” and so on, which
